articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: At least 35 Palestinians were killed early on Thursday in Israeli bombings of various areas in the Gaza Strip, the Palestinian news agency WAFA reported.
articles.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill 35 Palestinians on Thursday, Palestinian news agency reports

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: The United States is working to get an American citizen found on Thursday in Syria out of the country and bring him home, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said in Jordan, where he held meetings to discuss the political transition of Syria.
articles.title: US working to return US citizen from Syria, media identifies man as Timmerman

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuelan authorities said on Thursday that they have released 103 people this week who had been arrested amid anti-government protests following last July's contested presidential election.
articles.title: Venezuela releases dozens of detainees arrested after July's contested election

articles.author: Huseyin Hayatsever, Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Turkey on Thursday for talks focused on a critical aspect of establishing stability in Syria: clashes in the north of the country between U.S.-backed Kurdish forces and Turkey-backed rebels.
articles.title: Blinken meets Erdogan as forces backed by US, Turkey clash in Syria

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Umit Bektas
articles.description: Now covered in ashes and empty bullet casings, the grand mausoleum of ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's family stood in the eyes of rebels as a symbol of the injustice Syrians endured under their long rule.
articles.title: Amid ashes of Assad family's mausoleum, Syrian rebels vow to erase their legacy
At site of suspected mass killings, Syrians recall horrors, hope for answers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan defended Israel's operations in Syria since the fall of President Bashar al-Assad, saying on Thursday it had a right to defend itself from risks to its security.
articles.title: US security adviser Sullivan says Israel is acting in Syria for its own defence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A senior judge was assassinated in the Mexican resort city of Acapulco on Wednesday a day after the country's president convened security officials there to address a wave of violence.
articles.title: Judge killed in violence-plagued Mexican city a day after president's visit

articles.author: Sam Tobin, Michael Holden
articles.description: A Chinese businessman, who had forged close links with Prince Andrew and was authorised to act on his behalf to seek investors in China, has been banned from Britain on national security grounds.
articles.title: Chinese associate of Prince Andrew banned from UK as national security risk

articles.author: Nia Williams
articles.description: The Western Canadian province of Alberta will spend C$29 million ($20.46 million) to create a new sheriff-led patrol unit to police its 298-kilometer (185-mile) border with the U.S. state of Montana, the premier said on Thursday.
articles.title: Canadian province Alberta creates patrol unit to police US border
